io.mpos.accessories
Interface Accessory

All Known Subinterfaces:
PaymentAccessory
public interface Accessory

An accessory contains all information related to a specific accessory connection. The connection can be established by multiple channels (e.g. WiFi, Bluetooth, Dock-Connector, audio jack).

Since:
2.0.0

Method Summary
 AccessoryDetails getAccessoryDetails()
          Information about the device (including software version), only available once connected.
 int getBatteryLevel()
          Battery level of the accessory in range 0-100, -1 if not available.
 AccessoryBatteryState getBatteryState()
          Get the battery state of the accessory
 AccessoryCategory getCategory()
          Get the category of the accessory
 AccessoryConnectionState getConnectionState()
          Get the connection state of the accessory
 AccessoryConnectionType getConnectionType()
          Get the connection type used by the accessory
 AccessoryFamily getFamily()
          Gets the product family of the accessory.
 java.lang.String[] getIdleScreenText()
          Get the text that should be display when the accessory is connected but in idle mode.
 java.util.Locale getLocale()
          Returns the preferred locale for displaying text on the accessory.
 AccessoryType getType()
          Get the accessory type
 void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
          Returns the preferred locale for displaying text on the accessory.

getBatteryLevel

int getBatteryLevel()
Battery level of the accessory in range 0-100, -1 if not available.

Returns:
